results.title: From here to there: map reading
results.brief_description: Uses a fantasy journey by two American schoolboys to show the importance of using maps as a survival skill. Though not teaching map reading skills as such, this film should prove valuable as a basic introduction to the study of maps. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: From here to there
results.brief_description: This film shows an aeroplane trip from Los Angeles to New York. Points out the excitement and the poignancy of partings and greetings and the unique visual experience of flying. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: From Haiti to Trinidad
results.brief_description: A short travelogue containing documentary footage of various Caribbean Islands - Haiti, Barbados, Martinique, Puerto Rico, Trinidad. Includes shots of labourers interspersed with urban footage, topped off with a dash of sunny beaches. No commentary - English intertitles.

results.title: From Grisek: grade one
results.brief_description: For may years the rubber growers of Grisek, in Johore, Malaya, have been processing their own latex, with the result that it was of poor quality. Now, however, with the assistance of the Rural and Industrial Development Authority, they pool their resources and produce rubber. A modern factory enables first-class sheet rubber to be produced in ideal conditions and at the lowest possible cost. The rubber is then sold in bulk on the Singapore market.

results.title: From grass roots to green papers
results.brief_description: Activists in the Literacy movement got together with government representatives to develop policies and ideas regarding Literacy Issues in the International Literacy Year. The 13th National conference of the Australian Council for Adult Literacy was held in August 1989 in Tasmania.

results.title: From Glasgow Green to Bendigo
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland, Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Robert Irvine
results.brief_description: The design, manufacture and export of carpets. Highly skilled craftsment in a Glasgow factory are seen creating carpets from the basic design through intricate processes to the finished article. Carpets made for the Coronation, the White House, government buildings in New Zealand, South Africa and Rhodesia and in private homes, including one in Bendigo, Victoria.

results.title: From generation to generation
results.brief_description: The behaviour of the reproductive cells (wherein according to one theory the determinants of heredity are thought to be contained), together with the division of the nucleus in ordinary cell division, and the formation of reproductive cells, are illustrated by animated diagrams. Fertilization is explained by both animation and direct photography, and examples of the basic Mendelian principles of segregation and recombination are shown in rabbits, guinea pigs, and cattle. The white angora rabbit and the single-combed fowl are used as examples of the emergence of new types from the crossing of parents exhibiting independent pairs of Mendelian characteristics. The results of selective breeding of horses and dogs are also shown.

results.title: From every shires ende
results.creator_credit: Pilgrim Films, Mary Kirby and Naomi Diamond
results.brief_description: Life in Mediaeval England as illustrated in manuscripts, carvings, brasses etc of the time, combined with views of castles, churches and the countryside along the route of the Canterbury Pilgrims, presenting some of the background of Chaucer’s Tales.

results.title: From egg to newt (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Life cycle of the Common Newt showing the various stages in growth from the egg to a tadpole, to the young newt with gills and legs to finally the mature newt.
